documents.document: @Grumpyfck @dizd The 8x10 is a neg,
@dizd I only shoot paper in 8x10 so I didn't know this was even possible with film. I assume you still need a backlight for film?
@filmdevelop Sorry to hear that Gordon :(
@EMULSIVEfilm @Givemeabiscuit @andywasley @ILFORDPhoto I'd like to try one of Graflex's gigantic SLRs if I was to try it!
@geek7 @EMULSIVEfilm @SimonBedwell House painting is amazing there so if you like colour shooting you will have lots of it!
@geek7 @EMULSIVEfilm @SimonBedwell Not made it to Tirana yet but making my way around the region & it is on my list.
@Givemeabiscuit @EMULSIVEfilm @andywasley @ILFORDPhoto Not so easy to do LF on a lunchtime jaunt in central London!
@EMULSIVEfilm @SimonBedwell As a devotee of bonkers architecture may I suggest the Pyramid? https://t.co/72idM6anoU
Does sat crying at your desk because you feel at the same time out of your depth and totally unappreciated count as not enjoying your job?
@Givemeabiscuit @wordpressdotcom Oh and PanF 50 is lovely!
@Givemeabiscuit @wordpressdotcom It is certainly a good idea to get to the stage of being comfortable with a smaller number of stocks.
@LoveCommaCarla Absolutely! Star Trek?
@incasino_out @JuloPeter I like the sci-fi look a lot, that sort of false colour thing.I tried something with xpro architecture pinhole
@incasino_out @JuloPeter For portraits, neon is ideal!
@incasino_out @JuloPeter I really like this idea, I tried some false colour architecture pinhole (sci fi look) a while ago.
@MsShade Ways of seeing is great! Also I am very jealous as we posses no reading nook, dirty or clean.
@MarisaWriting Now we just all need to make podcasts and it will all become reality!
@MarisaWriting Of the ppl I have never met on here, I know what you sound like plus @JonWilkening @KristenWACamera
@incasino_out The challenge will be replicating this picture in a photograph!
@tonguetieon @kimmiechem2 Isn't that @incasino_out ? 😬
@sdMozmode That would ruin my day too!
@JT__photography Welcome! I have never adequately managed to convey how depression feels photographically myself.
My life is here & now. A cold fresh winter morning, a large camera on my back & endless recursive compositions.
My life is not the BBC news app, my life is not anxiety. My life is not keeping planes in the sky. My life is not fear or paranoia.
@DrMarsRover That is great! I think we can get that here. Will check...
@DrMarsRover Oh good, glad you are feeling better! Yeah, it is dark and dim here today, easy to feel glum.
@DrMarsRover Oh no, I'm sorry, I must have missed that :( Hope you are feeling better now!
@DanSmith74 Hope to get some keepers! They are skeletal wooden wrecks, quite large too.
Got some local shipwrecks lined up for pinholing near my home town coast this weekend. Bleak, quiet, near home & near a pub. Perfect!
@westen30 So I have sort of avoided them since.
@westen30 I don't wish to bash because maybe they came over wrong but I emailed them a couple of years ago abt something & seemed super rude
@JuloPeter I will check him out thanks!
@filmdevelop In all probability yes!
Finding an awful lot of solace perusing Sally Mann's landscapes. https://t.co/PBIT0njEMo
@stjohnsphoto I love Sally Mann's work,
@JT__photography I need one (several) of those! Going to the seaside with my pinhole next weekend will help hopefully.
@awwnuh sending you all the hugs.
@awwnuh Sorry to hear that :((( Hope you are doing ok and the 'kicking in' phase doesn't last too long. I hate that phase.
@ClickErik @HuffPostPol I've actually considered breaking a habit of a lifetime and putting a few £ on just this outcome.
Nice bit of news, I'm going to get to photograph the Dungeness Sound Mirrors in July! Yay! #believeinconcrete
@JuloPeter @DBloomsday Yes, would love to see. Like I say, this is all a long way off but I find myself more interested in astronomy now.
@KristenWACamera I'll keep breathing if you will ❤️
@JuloPeter @mparry1234 I'm years of making this happen, just thinking ahead. Right now I just want a telescope!
@mparry1234 The cool thing is you need the telescope to move during the exposure or you will get a blur!
@mparry1234 I have seen it done though. There was an Episode of Sky at Night last year that showed how to do it.
@mparry1234 Pick a good summer moonless night, a good telescope and cross your fingers!
I have decided my ultimate photographic aim is to produce a series of wetplate astrophotography images. Several challenges with this!
@DrMarsRover Oh that is fine, I have plenty of other things on the go to eat. Will be doing Toms which crop really well here.
@DrMarsRover Yes a company here sells a variety of tumbling ones. Also Blackberries.
@DrMarsRover Just as an aside, I'm going to buy one of those potted raspberries! Thanks for the tip.
@MarisaWriting @Frau_Inga @dfdy_ If you are headed to Canada I might just join you.
@DrMarsRover Plant the jungle!
@DrMarsRover I cant drive there so will be stuck
I have a PhD, my wife a Masters degree. We now work for a pan European company that makes Billions but hey ho
@Palaeoboy Home Secretary who decided they would arbitrarily change the rules while we were just trying to live together. Theresa May
I trusted my government before I married an immigrant, Then I realised how little my rights mattered. I understand. https://t.co/k2VDCo4FjI
@filmdevelop Cocoa Beach *SPRING BREAK*
@filmdevelop Whereas in Tehran, I could take all the pictures and meet interesting people.Ea all the good Persian food.
@filmdevelop I am going by myself, during spring break. I am going to sit on a beach being a grumpy old man.
Actually don't want to get banned from the U.S because of @DrMarsRover @MarisaWriting @KristenWACamera @JonWilkening and so many others.
Currently wondering if a speedy trip to Tehran will get me out of this work trip to Florida I really don't want to go on.
@puntofisso I used to think Brave New World was the more realistic dystopia, I'd never seen doublethink in the real world. Now I have.
I grew up with a distant view of these forts. One day I will visit them. I wonder how I would pinhole them. https://t.co/yv4ChQ9aXd
@achatainfr Thanks! Won't stop trying. It eats away at inspiration though. No significant lens based work in months. So lucky for pinhole.
@andywasley @JuloPeter @EMULSIVEfilm Hope it brings you lots of joy. I don't own a Holga but I so get why they are addictive!
One happy thing this week. I've noticed people associate me so much with pinhole I get tagged in their shots. It is flattering, thanks guys!
@KristenWACamera I know hun, it sucks doesn't it? Hard to see the possibility for recovery in the deep end.
@BrutalHouse 'Because I don't live in Poundbury'
Now I have to find a way to not beat myself up about yet another unproductive weekend.
I tried to self medicate with photography in London today. Then the panic hit and I am back home :(
@Givemeabiscuit @Grumpyfck @EMULSIVEfilm I will have some leftover Haggis tomorrow. Might give it a go!
@KristenWACamera She shoots what she likes on the only camera she has. You are a superb photographer, so shoot what you like, will be great!
@KristenWACamera One of my favourite photographers is my friend from work, she just posts pics from her phone on holiday. I love them.
@Givemeabiscuit @Grumpyfck @EMULSIVEfilm Haggis Samosas? Now I know such things exist I cannot be happy until I have had one.
@KristenWACamera By the way, you own a Hassy right?
@DrMarsRover @donkittle @EMULSIVEfilm @emmef2 Sky detail...now there is something I seldom get with paper/pinhole!
@KristenWACamera You take good photographs. I wouldn't worry. The only reason I tag things as pinhole is to chat to those of a likemind.
@AllThingsEla Yeah, speaking as a big geek of all things Russian, it hasn't gripped me...and that vignetting is bizarre.
Someone tell the cinematographer of Child 44 that Russian lenses of the 50s were much better than the weird effect their film is mimicking.
Woke up to someone telling me that my comments on her pictures make her day. Faith in social media restored.
@MarisaWriting I will support this motion so long as you allow me to refer to Pesto as the same.
Big hug to my friends. You all know who you are. I have been through the wringer several times and you come through for me every time ❤️💛💚💙💜
@JuloPeter @dsamaddar I got told by a friend on Instagram that my comments on her work make her day. Interesting comments are so important.
@dsamaddar @mparry1234 waffle or nuance in inaccurate language.. sometimes that is where joy lays.
@dizd @ILFORDPhoto @Flickr My Mum and Dad have this on their wall, it;s from near their home. No greater privilege!
@dizd @ILFORDPhoto A lovely film... this is it in Rodinal https://t.co/wMDAqE4VlP
@dizd But I do know I will love Major Kira till my dying breath.
@mparry1234 @dsamaddar I've tried to force pics during travels that would have been better had I waited or told work I needed more leave!
@mparry1234 @dsamaddar Even If it wasn't his meaning, getting the feel for places before trying to take pictures is good advice anyway.
Recovering by watching more #DS9 In Sisko we trust!
@dsamaddar Incidentally, the foreword to 'The Americans' is my favourite bit of Kerouac writing. Prob because he wasn't allowed to waffle.
@dsamaddar Not sure really it means more than a metaphor along those lines. I revealed once I am no scientist but I did a lot of Eng lit!
@dsamaddar I guess I'm employing some poetic licence here. A sort of passive looking equating to listening vs active looking meaning looking
@dsamaddar But it could be just a 'deepity', although that sort of thing doesn't sound right out of a cantankerous old sod like Frank
@dsamaddar At a stretch, learning to absorb the background movements, light and scenes of a place before actively searching for pics?
@SamiraAhmedUK I'm sure there is a reason why this can happen but currently not imaginative to work it out.
@KristenWACamera Don't be worried Kristen, I'm not a risk to myself. Just not good to be around at the mot. Lost a lot of friends yesterday.
Today will be brought to you by the sound of silence.
Yesterday was brought to you by inadequate mental health care, papering over cracks & the reality of chronic depression.
@awwnuh That made me depressed and ill 10 years ago & I can't really cope now.
